newsitem.title: UK: Buba's Koebnick - Mark won't fall over next 2 yrs.
newsitem.headline: Buba's Koebnick - Mark won't fall over next 2 yrs.

text.p: Bundesbank council member Hans-Juergen Koebnick said on Tuesday he did not expect the mark to fall further over the next two years.
Asked whether the mark was set to fall further over the next couple of years, Koebnick told Reuters Financial Television: "I don't think so."
"The relation to the dollar is more or less a normal relation," he said.
From the end of July to mid-October the dollar gained more than five percent on the mark, although it has recently relinquished some of those gains.
Earlier Koebnick, who was speaking in London, said that the German discount, Lombard and repo rates were all very low.
"We don't see a necessity at the moment to change any of these rates. There would be no effect," he said.
